comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Charles Spalding Thomas (1849-1934) – U.S. Senator (D) from Colorado, 1913-1921. Chairman, Committee on Woman Suffrage (Sixty-third and Sixty-fourth Congresses). Served briefly in the Confederate Army; Governor of Colorado 1899-1901; graduated from the law department of the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor in 1871; admitted to the bar in 1871; moved to Colorado and commenced practice in Denver, Colorado. Born Darien, McIntosh County, Ga., December 6, 1849; Died in Denver, Colo., June 24, 1934. –More

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks for the information Pixel Wrangler.  We'll revise the name in the title, and add a better estimate of the date when we update the record.
